instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
threads.message:
Hello friends,

This mac arrived without working. it had oxidation on the <CHIP>U6101</CHIP>, I replaced it and now it works, but it takes 1 to 2 minutes to chime. Tried with a clean BIOS here on the forum, continues.

The Mac works normally after it turns on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
threads.message: I had already tried resetting PRAM and SMC, it didn't work. The strange thing is that it takes time to chime to turn on and also to restart.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
threads.message: One more problem! I found out that the mac does not come out of rest!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
threads.message:
Test the machine disconnecting trackpad/keyboard.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal when turn it on.

I recommend you to reball SMC, as you've found corrosion close to it.
Also be sure all SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces are good.
Clean/remove J6100, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime taking a long time
threads.message:
Thanks a lot for the help!

I had already reballed the smc, but it didn't work.

I decided to change the <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> component again and the mac was 100%.
